creator: pvtrifonov@front.ru
text:
Windows XP box has a shared folder with some files.
FreeBSD 4.7 box mounts this share as /mnt/library. All FreeBSD users can read 
files from this mounted directory perfectly.

There is a symlink from the Apache DocumentRoot directory to this directlry,
that is .../htdocs/papers points to /mnt/library.
If brouser (IE from windows box) is pointed to the appropriate URL, the 
contents of this directory is listed, but if one tries to download a file 
larger than 255 bytes, zero-sized file is downloaded. Small files are 
downloaded without problems.
The following messages are logged in error_log after unsuccessfull downloads:
 [info] (45)Operation not supported: core_output_filter: writing data to the 
network


Files located in other places under DocumentRoot (i.e. not on the windows share)
are downloaded perfectly

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
Please try for the location in question:

EnableSendfile Off

does it change anything?

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
Try coding "EnableSendfile Off" in a container representing the smbfs directory
to see if that works around the problem.

Apache 2 by default will use sendfile() on static files.  However, not all
filesystems support sendfile(), so the "EnableSendfile" directive is used to
toggle this behavior as necessary to work around system limitations.

Plz let us now if this helps.  If it continues to fail, use truss to verify that
sendfile() is not being used, and let us know which syscall returned the error.

creator: pvtrifonov@front.ru
text:
Thanks,
EnableSendfile Off 

solves the problem
